victim.name: Kira Vex
victim.occupation: High-level cybersecurity architect specializing in neural interface defenses for corporate espionage countermeasures within a towering megacorp.
victim.personality: Calculating and fiercely independent, often isolating herself to maintain focus (primary), but harbors a deep-seated paranoia about betrayal fueled by past backstabbing (hidden).
victim.cause_of_death: Succumbed to lethal overheating caused by a sabotaged neural interface suit that dangerously amplified her body heat in the sealed server vault.

profile.name: Jaxon Tyrell
profile.description: Head of corporate espionage, outwardly ruthless and calculating in his strategies to dominate rival megacorps (primary); secretly suffers from guilt over a failed operation that indirectly endangered Kira (hidden vulnerability).
profile.relationship_to_victim: Former collaborator turned rival after Kira exposed his unethical methods.

original_mmo.means: Jaxon covertly reprogrammed the neural interface diagnostics firmware to trigger an overheating feedback loop within Kira's suit, exploiting his deep knowledge of her cutting-edge security systems.
original_mmo.motive: Haunted by guilt over a failed operation that endangered Kira, he sought to both eliminate her as a threat and silence the maniacally distrustful whistleblower who could unravel his corporate empire.
original_mmo.opportunity: Using his clearance and insider access, Jaxon infiltrated the sealed server vault during a rare maintenance window when surveillance protocols temporarily loosened, ensuring no witnesses to his sabotage.

profile.name: Dahlia Rune
profile.description: An underground hacker known for her chaotic style and anarchistic motives (primary), yet she harbors a strange respect and cryptic friendship toward Kira from a past encounter (secondary).
profile.relationship_to_victim: Shadowy hacker who had occasional, uneasy alliances with Kira during corporate infiltration missions.

original_mmo.means: Dahlia injected a stealth malware patch into Kira's neural interface firmware during a recent joint breach, covertly triggering the suit's thermal regulators to malfunction under specific biometric signals.
original_mmo.motive: Desiring to dismantle corporate tyranny yet conflicted by her respect for Kira, Dahlia eliminated her before Kira could secure an impregnable defense system that would tighten corporate control beyond redemption.
original_mmo.opportunity: During their last encrypted data exchange inside the sealed server vault, Dahlia exploited her intimate knowledge of Kira’s neural interface protocols to execute the sabotage unnoticed.

modified_mmo_elements.original_element_description: During their last encrypted data exchange inside the sealed server vault, Dahlia exploited her intimate knowledge of Kira’s neural interface protocols to execute the sabotage unnoticed.
modified_mmo_elements.modified_element_description: Although present for the encrypted data exchange, security logs reveal Dahlia’s neural interface emitted a unique frequency that triggered a lockdown protocol confining her to an isolated chamber separate from Kira within the sealed server vault, preventing any physical tampering during the sabotage timeframe.
modified_mmo_elements.reason_for_modification: The enforced physical separation by security measures invalidates Dahlia’s ability to execute the sabotage during the critical period.

profile.name: Dr. Elias Vorn
profile.description: Corporate neuroscientist responsible for neural interface hardware, professional and calm but obsessed with perfecting his tech at any cost (primary), hiding a covert agenda to sell secrets to competitors (secret).
profile.relationship_to_victim: Provided neural suits to Kira's department and resented her criticisms on his designs.

original_mmo.means: Dr. Vorn subtly implanted a malicious firmware update within the neural interface suit's cooling algorithm, causing it to dangerously amplify Kira's body heat until fatal overheating occurred.
original_mmo.motive: Vorn grew increasingly frustrated by Kira's public denunciations undermining his research, and feared her relentless drive would expose his covert plans to sell proprietary tech to rival corporations, threatening his secret agenda.
original_mmo.opportunity: Having exclusive access to the suits’ software updates and unmonitored server vault maintenance windows, Vorn remotely deployed the sabotaged update during a critical system sync when Kira was using the neural interface in isolation.

modified_mmo_elements.original_element_description: Dr. Vorn subtly implanted a malicious firmware update within the neural interface suit's cooling algorithm, causing it to dangerously amplify Kira's body heat until fatal overheating occurred.
modified_mmo_elements.modified_element_description: Although Dr. Vorn had access to the neural interface suits, a recent security audit revealed his firmware update deployments required dual authorization codes he could not access alone, making malicious updates unlikely without collaborator involvement.
modified_mmo_elements.reason_for_modification: The dual authorization requirement significantly limits Vorn's ability to plant malicious firmware independently, weakening his means.

evidence_items.description: A corrupted firmware update file logged in the megacorp's secure server history, traced back to Jaxon's encrypted credentials shortly before Kira's demise.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: This digital trace proves Jaxon's technical ability to manipulate the neural interface diagnostics firmware.

evidence_items.description: A hidden audio recording reveals Jaxon bitterly confessing to a trusted colleague that eliminating Kira was necessary to protect the empire and silence her relentless whistleblowing.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: The recording exposes Jaxon's psychological motive driven by guilt and fear of exposure.

evidence_items.description: Security logs show Jaxon's unusual presence in the server vault during a maintenance window with suspended surveillance, an opportunity no other employee accessed at that time.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: These logs confirm Jaxon's exclusive access opportunity to sabotage Kira's suit undetected.

evidence_items.description: An encrypted message sent from Dahlia's neural implant during the data exchange timestamping a virtual lockdown that restricted her physical movements away from Kira.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: This log appears to place Dahlia in the vicinity but actually shows she was simultaneously confined away, misleading about her physical opportunity.

evidence_items.description: A discarded micro-transceiver found near the server vault that matches a model used for covert proximity tracking, traced back to Dahlia's equipment but with no definitive usage logs.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: Implies Dahlia could monitor or track Kira's movements closely, but the lack of logs casts doubt on any tampering opportunity during the incident.

evidence_items.description: A discarded encrypted datapad with partial logs of a firmware update session, found in Dr. Vorn's office, containing fragments of code resembling the neural interface's cooling algorithm adjustments.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: Implies Dr. Vorn's involvement in firmware updates but ignores that full deployment requires dual authorization he lacks.

evidence_items.description: A series of sharply worded internal emails from Kira criticizing Vorn's research ethics, intercepted on the corporate communication network.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: Suggests Vorn harbors strong motives to sabotage Kira but overlooks other suspects with equal or greater grudges.
